search_results.title: I Love You Always Forever
search_results.lyrics:
I Love You Always Forever Lyrics[Verse 1]
Feels like I'm standing in a timeless dream
Of light mist, of pale amber rose
Feels like I'm lost in a deep cloud of heavenly scent
Touching, discovering you

[Verse 2]
Those days of warm rains come rushing back to me
Miles of windless summer night air
Secret moments shared in the heat of the afternoon
Out of the stillness, soft spoken words
[Chorus]
I love you always, forever
Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you
I love you always, forever
Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you

[Verse 3]
You've got the most unbelievable blue eyes I've ever seen
You've got me almost melting away
As we lay there, under a blue sky with pure white stars
Exotic sweetness, a magical time

[Chorus]

Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you
I love you always, forever
Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you

Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you
I love you always, forever
Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you
I love you always, forever
Near and far, closer together
Everywhere I will be with you
Everything, I will do for you7Embed

description.plain:
With “I Love You Always Forever,” Aussie synth-pop singer Betty Who resurrects an oft-forgotten ’90s favorite. Released by Welsh singer Donna Lewis in 1996, the original version reached #2 on the Billboard Hot 100. In an interview with Spin, Betty explained why she wanted to cover the track:


It’s one of those songs that you don’t know, and when you hear it you go, ‘Ah I know this song.’

I think those are the best ones to cover because it still feels fresh and it still feels new but there’s such a deep familiarity about it that you can’t get.


The song was Betty’s first single since the drop of her debut studio album in 2014. It retroactively became the first promotional single for her sophomore record, The Valley, after the cover’s surprising popularity convinced Who to include it on the tracklist.

As Betty told Vogue, she doesn’t remember the first time she heard “I Love You Always Forever.”


All I know is, it was everywhere. It came out in ’96, so I was 5 and it was literally on every radio station, on the charts for like 12 weeks or something.

And to me, listening to that song, I got a lovely warm feeling about recollections of my childhood.


Who released a music video for the track on July 14, 2016.

body.plain:
With “I Love You Always Forever,” Aussie synth-pop singer Betty Who resurrects an oft-forgotten ’90s favorite. Released by Welsh singer Donna Lewis in 1996, the original version reached #2 on the Billboard Hot 100. In an interview with Spin, Betty explained why she wanted to cover the track:


It’s one of those songs that you don’t know, and when you hear it you go, ‘Ah I know this song.’

I think those are the best ones to cover because it still feels fresh and it still feels new but there’s such a deep familiarity about it that you can’t get.


The song was Betty’s first single since the drop of her debut studio album in 2014. It retroactively became the first promotional single for her sophomore record, The Valley, after the cover’s surprising popularity convinced Who to include it on the tracklist.

As Betty told Vogue, she doesn’t remember the first time she heard “I Love You Always Forever.”


All I know is, it was everywhere. It came out in ’96, so I was 5 and it was literally on every radio station, on the charts for like 12 weeks or something.

And to me, listening to that song, I got a lovely warm feeling about recollections of my childhood.


Who released a music video for the track on July 14, 2016.
She’s actually said it’s not the first single from her sophomore album. It’s just a little something to tide fans over.

search_results.full_title: BLOW OUT MY CANDLE by Betty Who
search_results.title: BLOW OUT MY CANDLE
search_results.lyrics:
BLOW OUT MY CANDLE Lyrics[Verse 1]
You don't know me, you don't get it
You really sold me, but you never met me halfway
'Cause you don't see it, where this train's headed
But best believe me, you're not gonna get in my way

[Pre-Chorus]
Does it help you sleep?
Does it make you stronger
To beat up on me?
I can't take it any longer
[Chorus]
I won't stop running down that road
I'll keep dancing 'til I die
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire
So don't stop, I've been here and I know
You can't quit even when it hurts you try
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire

[Verse 2]
You don't know me, you don't understand it
I'm not the old me, cryin' in the ballroom backstage
Look up and see it, where this plane's headed
That bird you let go, it's never getting back in that cage

[Pre-Chorus]
Did it help you sleep?
Did it make you stronger
Beating up on me?
I won't take it any longer

[Chorus]
I won't stop running down that road
I'll keep dancing 'til I die
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire
So don't stop, I've been here and I know
You can't quit even when it hurts to try
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire
You might also like[Bridge]
I'm up in smoke
Soft tires, pump that choke (Come on)
Who's gonna feed the flame?
Who's gonna feed the flame?
Like moonlight, you fade away
Forget me, forget my face
But you'll never forget my name
Don't ever forget my name

[Chorus]
'Cause I won't stop running down that road
I'll keep dancing 'til I die
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire
I won't stop, I've been here and I know
You can't quit even when it hurts to try
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire

[Outro]
I won't stop running down that road
I'll keep dancing 'til I die
You can blow out my candle
But you'll never put out my fire
(But you'll never put out my fire)Embed

description.plain: When asked, Betty Who told MTV “It’s about perseverance”.

search_results.title: BIG
search_results.lyrics:
BIG Lyrics[Verse 1]
Little girl in a red and white dress
Sitting front row for picture day
Her mom spent all morning tying up her hair
In a bow, with just a touch of spray
There she is, smiling ear-to-ear
Teacher says, "You gotta stand in the back
You know you're too tall, be quiet, stay small"
And you bet she learned to live with that

[Pre-Chorus]
Ain't that the story?
Saying sorry just for being yourself
So insecure 'bout something I couldn't help
[Chorus]
I'm big, larger than life
A million miles high
That once-in-a-century
Big, if legends are loud
And built to stand out
Guess that's who I'm meant to be
Tеn feet tall and I'm proud of it
You can't make me smaller
You'll nеver make me fit
'Cause, baby, I was born to be big

[Verse 2]
I wanna feel, I wanna let it all in
Wanna laugh until I wanna cry
'Cause it's a big world for a big-hearted
Big girl, keep on running till I run it dry

[Pre-Chorus 2]
You ain't seen nothing
I won't apologize for taking up space
I'm not gonna fight it
I've been long out of place

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm big, larger than life
A million miles high
That once-in-a-century
Big, if legends are loud
And built to stand out
Guess that's who I'm meant to be
Ten feet tall and I'm proud of it
You can't make me smaller
You'll never make me fit
'Cause, baby, I was born to be big
You might also like[Bridge]
Ain't that the story?

[Chorus]
'Cause I'm big - larger than life
A million miles high
That once-in-a-century
Big - if legends are loud
And built to stand out
Guess that's who I'm meant to be
Ten feet tall and I'm proud of it
You can't make me smaller
You'll never make me fit
'Cause, baby, I was born to be big

[Outro]
You know that I was born to be big
Baby, I was born to be bigEmbed

Ooh somebody loves you
Ooh somebody loves you

Why don't you lay me down

That's how easy this should be
You might also like[Chorus]

They wanna wake up with you everyday (They wanna wake up with you)
Somebody wants to hear you say (Oh they want you to say)
Ooh somebody loves you
Ooh somebody loves you
Ooh somebody loves you
Ooh somebody loves you

description.plain:
Betty Who’s debut single from her debut EP, The Movement.



It gained popularity after Spencer Stout posted a video of him proposing to his boyfriend with a flash mob dance routine at a Home Depot in Salt Lake City:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l4HpWQmEXrM

Official music video here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gTVFQHuIg2I

annotations:
I’m around when your head is heavy
 I’m around when your hands aren’t steady

This could be a nod to you being around for a person both physically and mentally. Yes, she’s talking about physical attributes, but both are metaphors. When your head is heavy, that can sometimes mean you are tired, or perhaps in a low mood. When your hands aren’t steady, this sometimes means you’re anxious, or unsure.

Somebody misses you when you’re away (Somebody misses you baby)
 They wanna wake up with you everyday (They wanna wake up with you)
 Somebody wants to hear you say (Oh they want you to say)
 Ooh somebody loves you
 Ooh somebody loves you
 Ooh somebody loves you
 Ooh somebody loves you
 Ooh somebody loves you
In the first stanza, she asks him(?) who loves him, cares about him, supports him. Then she sort of answers the question by saying somebody actually cares about him(?).

3 AM and all my friends are looking at me sideways

Almost called you, tried to text you like a million times
3 AM, but I don't care, I had to tell you someday
The way I'm feeling

[Chorus]
I can still feel you, you're everywhere
I can taste your lips, hear your voice in my head
And I know that I should shut my mouth
And just hang up the phone, but I still want you
I just thought you should know
[Verse 2]
Bet you're in the kitchen hoping she don't hear you whisper
Just admit it
Do you ever think of me when you lean in to kiss her?
Do you miss it? (Oh)

[Chorus]
'Cause I can still feel you, you're everywhere
I can taste your lips, hear your voice in my head
And I know that I should shut my mouth
And just hang up the phone, but I still want you (Want you)
I just thought you should know

[Post-Chorus]
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought you should know
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought, I just thought

[Bridge]
I'm so happy that you're happy with her (Wait, that's a lie)
Almost called you, tried to text you like a million times

[Chorus]
I can still feel you, you're everywhere
I can taste your lips, hear your voice in my head
And I know that I should shut my mouth
And just hang up the phone, but I still want you
Oh, I can still feel you, you're everywhere
I can taste your lips, hear your voice in my head
And I know that I should shut my mouth
And just hang up the phone, but I still want you
I just thought you should know
You might also like[Post-Chorus]
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought you should know
I just thought, I just thought
I just thought, I just thought

[Outro]
Don't wanna be without you
Don't wanna be without you, baby
I just thought you should know
I just thought, I just thoughtEmbed

search_results.title: Human Touch

Human Touch Lyrics[Verse 1]
Good love is so hard to find
We got it right for a while
Do you get lonely at night?
We don't have to go home
We don't have to go

[Pre-Chorus]
Low lights, cold nights, remember when?
I call you every now and then
So good, that on and off again
And on again
[Chorus]
Oh, why don't you come over?
Baby, be close to me, just like you used to be
Oh, one more night to hold ya
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch

[Verse 2]
I always loved how you kiss
And I'm overdue for a fix
Just with a touch of your lips
I want you to come home
I want you to come home

[Pre-Chorus]
Low lights, cold nights, remember when?
I call you every now and then
So good, that on and off again
And on again

[Chorus]
Oh, why don't you come over?
Baby, be close to me, just like you used to be
Oh, one more night to hold ya
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch (Yeah, yeah, yeah)
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch
You might also like[Bridge]
Baby, I love how we love in the in-between
Baby, I love how it feels when you're holding me
Baby, I love how we love in the in-between
Baby, I love it, I love it
Oh, why don't you come over?
Baby, be close to me, just like you used to be

[Chorus]
Oh, why don't you come over?
Baby be close to me, just like you used to be
Oh, one more night to hold ya
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch

[Outro]
We don't have to call it love, we just need a human touch1Embed

description.plain:
“Human Touch” is a tribute to blurred lines, as Betty Who playfully propositions a continued physical connection with an ex while reflecting on their relationship pre-break up.

The song is featured on Who’s 2017 sophomore album, The Valley, and was released as the record’s first official single on November 11, 2016. An acoustic version featuring Jarryd James came out a month later. “Human Touch” can also be heard in the first trailer for the 2017 film Everything, Everything.

annotations: And I’m overdue for a fix

Personally, I think this is a reference to how your car can be overdue for certain procedures. (though it doesn’t have to be exactly a car, thats just what I’m using here.) When she says she overdue for a fix, she’s trying to say that its been a long time since she’s had her “fix” or particular interaction with this individual.

description.plain:
The explosive “Wanna Be” opens a shaken soda can of emotion, as Betty Who earnestly confesses her long-harbored love for her best friend.

While developing romantic feelings for a friend is a common motif in Who’s music, this track focuses on a fresh obstacle: her friend’s current involvement with another woman. What follows is the constant push-and-pull of comparison, as Who’s voice seesaws between blasting confidence and breathy whispers, depicting the epic adrenaline rush of finally exposing hidden feelings while cleverly making Who’s main point a hushed moment amidst the roar: “I know she’s sweet, but she isn’t me.”

As the seventh track of The Valley, “Wanna Be” is both the literal and emotional centerpiece of Who’s sophomore record. In an album packed with punchier, pop-heavy tracks, this song is anchored in the dreamy, anthemic sound of her first studio album, Take Me When You Go. It’s atmospheric and expansive enough to easily fill a stadium, but is also firmly rooted in Who’s devotion to songwriting: “All of the songs [on the album]…can be played at a piano or with a guitar. I can actually sing you the story of the song with everything stripped away.”
